title: BBC Local Live: Norfolk on Wednesday, 16 March 2016 - BBC News
summary: chancellor george osborne announces devolution plans , including a directly-elected mayor , for norfolk , suffolk and cambridgeshire in today 's budget .
inspectors have told the norfolk and norwich university hospital it needs to improve , citing too few nurses and pressure on wards .
news , sport , weather and travel updates resume at 08:00 on thursday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's it from the norfolk live team for today .
we 'll be back from 08:00 bringing you the news , sport , travel and weather updates as they happen .

if you have any photographs from around the county that you 'd like to share , or if there 's anything happening that you 'd like us to know about , you can contact us via email , facebook or twitter .

documents.title: weather : cold with clear spells
text: dry with variable cloud and some clear spells at times overnight .
brisk northeasterly winds at first tomorrow will gradually ease and feeling rather chilly later in the night with temperatures falling to 3c ( 37f ) .
weather has your local forecast .

documents.title: wanted man arrested
text: norfolk police says a 34-year-old man who was wanted by police has been arrested .
john storey was wanted on recall to prison after breaching the terms of his licence .
storey was arrested yesterday in norwich and will now be returned to jail .

documents.title: tributes paid to 'caring and skilful ' cancer doctor found dead in old buckenham
text: the front page of the diss express :
author: Diss Express

documents.title: linnets sign striker on-loan
text: king 's lynn town have signed boston forward john sands on-loan until the end of the season .
the former leiston man has been used mainly as a substitute for the pilgrims in national league north this season .
linnets manager gary setchell said : `` john is somebody that i have i tried to sign the last three or four seasons but i 've failed every time .
i believe john can score goals for the football club and help us get back on the play-off trail . ''
author: Phil Daley
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: east anglian devolution : more discussion needed , say great yarmouth councillors
text: the main three political parties representing great yarmouth say they welcome the conversation on devolution for norfolk , suffolk and cambridgeshire but that there was still much to be discussed .

in a joint statement , tory council leader graham plant , labour shadow leader trevor wainwright and ukip group leader kay grey said : `` we remain concerned about the governance and cost of a combined authority and the powers of a mayor , and wish to be part of actively shaping any future proposal before a decision is made . ''

documents.title: election for norfolk 's youth parliament
text: twenty-six candidates are standing for election this week at norfolk 's youth parliament .
thousands of school and college pupils expected to vote via their mobile phone to choose the next generation to represent them .
members of youth parliament deal with the issues affecting younger people in their communities and nationally , working alongside local mps and councillors .
author: Tim Addicott
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: youngs ruled out for season
text: norfolk 's tom youngs , who plays for leicester tigers , has been ruled out for the rest of the season .
the england hooker is suffering from a back injury .
author: Rob Butler
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: grant for new sensory area for students with learning difficulties at city college
text: young people with profound and multiple learning difficulties who attend city college norwich are reaping the benefits of a new sensory area thanks to a £ 54,000 grant from the wolfson foundation .
the new space opened in september following a successful joint bid between the college and norfolk county council to the education funding agency .
the highly interactive sensory area features colourful bubble tubes , fibre optics and other visual stimuli including mirrors , a kaleidoscope and a star gazer .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: fund raising call centre goes into liquidation shedding 150 jobs
text: a fundraising call centre in norwich has gone into liquidation with the loss of up to 150 jobs .
accountancy firm larking gowen confirmed insight cci , which raised money for charities from its centre on st andrews hill , had gone into liquidation after running up debts of more than £ 700,000 .

insight 's company director told the eastern daily press it had suffered as a result of national adverse publicity surrounding the death of a women in bristol who had reportedly been hounded by charity requests .
author: Nanette Aldous
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: watch : champion spaniel shows off her moves
text: teasel the cocker spaniel , owned by claire burrell , from dereham , won the small singles agility category at crufts .
here she shows us just how clever she is
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: man denies stabbing another to death
text: a 31-year-old man from norwich has denied murdering a man who was stabbed to death .
lee tingle , 50 , was found with serious injuries at a property in suffolk square in norwich in december last year and declared dead at the scene .
kristian tarragan , also of suffolk square , denied murder at norwich crown court .
the court set a trial date for 31 may .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: headlines : east anglian devolution deal could create a combined authority norwich call centre goes into liquidation with loss of 150 jobs
text: the main news headlines :
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: walsh in line for a battle for britain
text: today 's eastern daily press back page :

documents.title: devolution deal : flying the flag for east anglia
text: following george osborne 's announcement of a devolution deal for cambridgeshire , norfolk and suffolk , will we see more flags of east anglia being flown around the region ?
the flag was designed in about 1900 and incorporates the english cross of st george , with a shield bearing three crowns ascribed in medieval times to the anglo saxon kingdom of east anglia .
it has recently been seen flying over norfolk county council 's headquarters and , as shown above , in this garden near cambridge .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: video game festival sets sights on young designers
text: the next generation of young video game designers are to be given the chance to show off their talents at an event in norwich later this month .

norwich gaming festival hopes to highlight up-and-coming talent and with video game development being taught in many schools in norfolk , the festival 's organiser says game-writing can be a good career :
i think it 's really important to encourage people to see it as a viable career path and that it 's an achievable goal . ''
author: Graham Barnard
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: norfolk specials to undergo intensive training
text: norfolk 's specials are preparing to take part in an intensive training event this week as police figures reveal the volunteer officers clocked up 76,600 hours on duty last year .
norfolk currently has 250 volunteer officers who undertook 11,225 duties in 2015 including carrying out 573 stop/searches , 331 licensing checks and 184 drug seizures .
domestic violence , stop and search , drink driving , robbery , public order and .
traffic offences will all be under the spotlight during the event .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: east anglian devolution will 'boost growth and drive economy '
text: the chairman of the new anglia local enterprise partnership has welcomed the chancellor 's announcement of a devolution agreement for cambridgeshire , norfolk and suffolk .

mark pendlington said : `` devolution brings a great opportunity to release even more potential from our vibrant towns and cities , giving us greater influence , control and decision making over vital areas of our economy from creating jobs , boosting skills , supporting our businesses and building the homes that we so desperately need .
`` devolution offers us a way to achieve our ambitions and showcase our great industries . ''
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: trading standards in norfolk and suffolk consider merger
text: norfolk 's trading standards department could merge with suffolk 's in an attempt to provide a better service and save money .
councillors will be discussing the proposal with both services agreeing it would help them to better react to issues like cross-border crime or an outbreak of an animal disease .
it 's not clear yet if any jobs would go in the process and a decision on the matter will be made in october .
author: Tim Addicott
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: workshop to advise charities how to crowdfund
text: norfolk charities having to find new ways of raising money are being given advice on crowdfunding today .
global giving uk is hosting a workshop in norwich and will be offering charities the knowledge and skills for setting up online public fundraising .
chief executive eleanor harrison says it 's about helping charities and community groups find new ways to raise money .
author: Tim Addicott
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: nathan redmond could be out for six weeks
text: the sun journalist ( and norwich fan ) charlie wyett says canaries winger nathan redmond could miss six weeks of the season due to an ankle injury .
redmond limped off at the end of the first half against manchester city last saturday .
the canaries have eight games left to avoid relegation from the premier league .
nathan redmond out for about 6 weeks for norwich with ankle ligament injury .

documents.title: fa cup may boost survival chances
text: the back page of the norwich evening news ;
author: Norwich Evening News

documents.title: east anglian devolution : 'residents have been shut out '
text: cambridge city council remains a notable opponent of the east anglian devolution deal , which neighbouring councils across cambridgeshire as well as in norfolk and suffolk have signed up to .
lewis herbert , leader of cambridge city council , said : `` residents have been shut out of the rushed talks in the last four weeks .
`` we believe it is now time their voice is heard , not just by us , but also by the government on these proposals for a huge region and mayor . ''
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: east anglian devolution : elections for new mayor could take place in may 2017
text: under devolution plans for cambridgeshire , norfolk and suffolk , the first mayoral elections could be held in may 2017 .
the directly elected mayor would lead a new east anglia combined authority and would exercise the following powers :
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: east anglian devolution : deal needs to be ratified by local councils
text: the east anglian devolution deal announced by chancellor george osborne still needs to be ratified by councils in cambridgeshire , norfolk and suffolk .

suffolk public sector leaders group , which comprises the leaders from all of the county 's district and borough councils and the county council , says further negotiation and clarification on the specifics of the deal will now take place , with `` extensive engagement '' with local communities and businesses .

documents.title: east anglian devolution : 'a profound transfer of powers from whitehall '
text: george nobbs , leader of norfolk county council , says the chancellor 's announcement of a draft devolution agreement for east anglia `` sees the start of a profound transfer of powers from whitehall to this region '' .
george osborne announced plans which he says will see a single authority and elected mayor for norfolk , suffolk and cambridgeshire .
`` each and every council in the region will now debate the draft document as details are worked up , '' mr nobbs said .
`` i am personally delighted that this is a deal specifically for east anglia .
`` this is not a region created by central dictate , it is deeply rooted in english history and has possessed a distinct identity for more than a thousand years . ''
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: budget : £ 7m to fix potholes
text: as well as east anglian devolution , the chancellor george osborne also used the budget to allocate £ 7m to fix potholes in the east over the next year .
# budget2016 also allocates £ 7 mill to fill 136,000 potholes in east over the next year
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: more detail on east anglian devolution deal from treasury
text: hm treasury has revealed more details of chancellor george osborne 's devolution plans for east anglia :
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: mps react to east anglian devolution plans
text: mps , including mid-norfolk 's george freeman , have been reacting to the east anglian devolution announcement made by chancellor george osborne during the budget .
the plans pave the way for the creation of a single authority for cambridgeshire , norfolk and suffolk , with an elected mayor .
bingo .
a new c£ 1bn # devolutiondeal for east anglia # budget2016
@ twitterid not sure where that will get us in reality ?
@ twitterid very persuasive in @ twitterid article this morning
@ twitterid norfolk , suffolk and cambridge or just norfolk & suffolk ?
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: devolution announcement 'a significant step ' for east anglia
text: matthew hancock , conservative mp for west suffolk , says the chancellor 's devolution announcement is a `` significant step '' for east anglia .
george osborne announced plans which he says will hand more powers to cambridgeshire , norfolk and suffolk during his budget .

`` the devolution deal brings more money , new powers , and will give us a strong local figurehead who can unite east anglia and make our case heard locally , nationally and internationally , '' mr hancock said .
`` i pay tribute to the hard work by many people that has enabled us to reach this point , and look forward to making local decision making a reality . ''

documents.title: chancellor promises £ 1bn investment as part of east anglian devolution
text: east anglian devolution plans will bring £ 1bn of investment to cambridgeshire , norfolk and suffolk , chancellor george osborne has announced in the budget .
this would be part of a deal introducing a single authority and an elected mayor for the three counties .
author: Mark Williamson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: breakingchancellor confirms east anglian devolution plans
text: george osborne has used the budget to unveil east anglian devolution plans , which he says will hand more powers to cambridgeshire , norfolk and suffolk .
the chancellor told mps the plans would see a single authority for east anglia , with an elected mayor , which will make sure `` the rewards of economic growth are in the hands of local people '' .

documents.title: 150 jobs lost at call centre
text: here is today 's norwich evening news front page :
author: Norwich Evening News

documents.title: east anglian devolution : elected mayor would serve three counties
text: chancellor george osborne has begun his budget speech , in which he is expected to announced devolution plans and pave the way for an elected mayor for east anglia .
the idea is that a mayor would be elected to serve across norfolk , suffolk and cambridgeshire .
but we 're not yet at the stage of knowing when a mayor would be elected , and there 's a lot of ground to be travelled before any final deal is signed off .
author: Tom Barton
BBC Look East political reporter

documents.title: more details on 'eastern powerhouse ' expected in budget
text: further details are expected to be revealed about plans for east anglian devolution in the chancellor 's budget this lunchtime .

the combining of norfolk , suffolk and cambridgeshire into an `` eastern powerhouse '' would , it is argued , give the region more say on spending , but cambridge city council , the only authority out of 23 councils in the three counties not to support the plans , claims any extra cash is pitiful .
the money on the table is about £ 1m per council per year and that really is n't going to make any difference .
our infrastructure needs hundreds of millions of pounds just for cambridge . ''
author: Graham Barnard
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: headlines : details on east anglian devolution to be announced in budget hospital 'requires improvement ' say health inspectors
text: main news stories this lunchtime :
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: hospital nursing staff need to be 'directed better ' , says health inspectors
text: a health watchdog says norfolk and norwich university hospital nhs trust 's management of nursing staff could be `` directed better to provide cover where the pressure is greatest '' , after finding some wards were n't being covered adequately .
the care quality commission 's latest inspection report found the hospital required improvement overall

it was rated good for in three areas including a & e and intensive/critical care but required improvement in eight other areas including older people 's care , maternity and gynaecology , and end-of-life care .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: n & n trust must do better
text: today 's eastern daily press front page :
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: beach huts broken into in north norfolk
text: norfolk police has issued a warning to beach hut owners :
beach hut owners warned to be vigilant after two have been broken into in cromer # cromer

documents.title: hospital 'doing everything it can ' to address nursing shortfall
text: the chief executive of the norfolk and norwich university hospital nhs trust says the hospital is doing `` everything it can '' to recruit more medical staff after a cqc report , published today , found a shortage of nurses was affecting care provision .
the hospital was found to require improvement in almost all areas apart from emergency and intensive critical care services which were found to be good , and the hospital was found to be caring .

chief executive mark davies said it was `` under enormous pressure '' but was `` planning to expand capacity '' to cope with the areas identified as requiring more improvement , including elective and surgical care and day surgery .

documents.title: thetford town win 'massive ' game
text: thetford town 's relegation fight received a boost last night with a 3-1 win at gorleston in the thurlow nunn premier .
brecklanders boss danny white told bbc radio norfolk : `` every point counts now , so that result was massive for us . ''
thetford remain in the relegation zone , but are now just a point from safety .
author: Phil Daley
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: travel : a1151 queues at wroxham
text: a removals van is partly blocking the a1151 wroxham causing long queues back to hoveton .
there are 20-minute delays .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: 'eastern powerhouse ' details on devolution expected from chancellor
text: the chancellor is expected to announce details of the so-called eastern powerhouse for norfolk , suffolk and cambridgeshire in his budget this afternoon .
the devolved region would be given extra decision-making powers to run itself more independently from parliament and would also see a directly-elected mayor for the first time .
the move has been agreed by all authorities in the three counties , except cambridge city council .
author: Nanette Aldous
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: norfolk and norwich university hospital rated as needing improvement overall by inspectors
text: health inspectors say the norfolk and norwich university hospital trust requires improvement overall .
a care quality commission ( cqc ) inspection found a shortage of nursing staff was having an impact on care , especially in the areas of palliative care and ward management .

the watchdog says parts of the trust `` require improvement to provide safe , responsive and effective services '' but a & e , and intensive critical care services were rated by inspectors as good with `` exceptionally caring staff '' .
author: Graham Barnard
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: weather : brightening up with sunny spells
text: some decent spells of sunshine but the northwesterly breeze will keep temperatures on the cool side , averaging about 6c ( 43f ) .
weather has more local details ,
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning and welcome to our live coverage for norfolk
text: hello and welcome to wednesday 's norfolk live .
between now and 18:00 , the team here will bring you the news , sport , travel and weather updates as we get them .
we 're always interested in what 's happening in your part of norfolk , so if there 's anything you wish to share , contact us on email , facebook or twitter .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live
